resources.string: Tracing started!\nMake sure you stop it at some point
Tracing initiating failed! Check logcat for details.
A few tips about how to use AnySoftKeyboard
ࢎ\u0020Swipe left or right for more tips࢐
To access the settings; long press the ENTER key. You\'ll find a world of customizations there!

With a swipe, you can do a lot! Swipe from left to right will switch languages, swiping to the left will switch to symbols layout, swiping from the spacebar up will show up a utility keyboard, and swiping down will hide the keyboard.\nIt is configurable in the settings (remember? Long pressing the ENTER key).

There are some hidden keyboards:\n1) Swipe your finger from the spacebar and up, you\'ll get a utility keyboard with arrows and microphone (for voice input).\n2) Swipe your finger up outside the keyboard, and keep it pressed. This is the extension keyboard, with numbers and symbols.
The top row is the same on all layouts, and it can be changed! The default top row includes symbols key (123), left and right arrow keys, and language key (ABC). You can replace this row in settings.
Sometimes it is nice to get a non-visual feedback about key presses. I support that. So here you go, you can have vibration or sound, or both.
As the top row, the bottom row can also be replaced. AnySoftKeyboard has several types - with or without a mic, iPhone style, etc.

Typing is nice, but there is also support for voice input! Want to dictate the text? Click the microphone key, and talk away!\nThis feature uses Google\'s state-of-the-art voice recognition technology, so be sure it works :)

If you want to always have the mic icon, make sure you have the correct bottom row (previous tip, remember?).\nAnyway, mic is always accessible via the hidden utility keyboard (swipe up from the spacebar).
* Requires Android 2.2+ and Internet connection to work.

Depending on your language support level, AnySoftKeyboard can help you finish your words and correct your typos. As you start typing, AnySoftKeyboard will suggest words based on what you already typed.

If I don\'t know a word, you can teach me! Type that word, and click it in the suggestions strip. I\'ll remember it.\nYou can also edit those User-Words in our built-in editor. Look for the editor in AnySoftKeyboard Dictionary Settings.

AnySoftKeyboard provides word completion suggestions based on what you typed. But, AnySoftKeyboard can also provide suggestions on already typed words! Tap the word, and AnySoftKeyboard will refresh the suggestions strip.
AnySoftKeyboard is not a regular application - it is a on-screen keyboard replacement.
For further information, go to the Links tab.
Details about how to use this keyboard:
This application was created with the help of the following people-
AnySoftKeyboard is not activated yet. Do you want me to show you how to activate?
Android requires that you (the user) will manually enable and activate external keyboards. Here is how:
Step 1: Enable AnySoftKeyboard (it will warn you about possible key-logging, don\'t worry, AnySoftKeyboard does not keep data, and does not send it anywhere) :
Press BACK once done, to get back to activation instructions
Step 2: Select AnySoftKeyboard as your active Input Method:
Step 3 (optional): AnySoftKeyboard is very customizable. Change stuff! You can do that later by long-press the ENTER key.
This is a beta version. Use with caution!
Get more keyboards at Play Store…
Get more Quick-Text add-ons at Play Store…

For now, AnySoftKeyboard does not allow external packs of this type.\nOnce API specifications have been determined, this feature will be opened.\nStay tuned.
Keyboard layouts for use in AnySoftKeyboard
Select top, bottom rows or extension keyboard
Common bottom keys row across all your keyboards
Various appearance themes for your on-screen keyboard
Simple black theme with color highlights
Dark theme, with minimal UI elements
Same Dark theme, but with larger keys.
Playing around with a new bottom row
Keyboard layout can be changed by swiping you finger over the keyboard. Swipe left-to-right to change language, swipe right-to-left to change to symbols.

AnySoftKeyboard is not fully set-up for use. Click here to set up.
Click to add a new word
Previous setup step is not complete
Please swipe to the previous step, and follow the instructions.
AnySoftKeyboard is enabled. You are only one step away from using AnySoftKeyboard on your awesome device!
AnySoftKeyboard is your default keyboard. But, you\'ll probably want to set-up additional things, like themes or languages?
This is the first step, but don\'t worry, there are only three, very simple steps.
In this step, you\'ll need to enable AnySoftKeyboard. Please check \'AnySoftKeyboard\' in your Language&Input settings. This will allow us to run on your device.
Error: Your device does not support 3rd-party keyboards. AnySoftKeyboard can not be activated!
Your system can use AnySoftKeyboard now, but it is not set as the active keyboard.\nBy switching, AnySoftKeyboard will be your new on-screen keyboard, along with all its features!
Thank you for choosing AnySoftKeyboard.\nThis keyboard excel in its customization level. Go ahead and personalize:
Oops, AnySoftKeyboard crashed, didn\'t see that coming…

Unfortunately, there is a problem with AnySoftKeyboard. Do not panic, there is something you can do to help resolve this: send us the crash report, and we\'ll do our best to solve this crash and get you back with an awesome keyboard experience!\n\nWith sincere apology, the Dev team.
